nextOptions.title: Cardiogenic Shock
nextOptions.description:
SBP<90 or need of vasopressor or inotropes to maintain SBP>90

Evidence of systemic hypoperfusion (e.g. elevated lactate, elevated creatinine/oliguria, ALT/AST, cold extremitie.

nextOptions.title: Cardiac Arrest post-ROSC
nextOptions.description:
Possible ischemic, based on:

• Clinical history
• STE or STD on EKG
• VT/VF arrest

nextOptions.title: • Transfer to ICU with Swan-Ganz in place +/- Impella removal

MCS Decision Making Algorithms in patien.title: MCS Decision Making Algorithms in patients with Cardiogenic Shock

nextOptions.title: No chances of recovery within 2 weeks
nextOptions.nextKey: No chances of recovery within 2 weeks

No chances of recovery within 2 weeks.title: No chances of recovery within 2 weeks
No chances of recovery within 2 weeks.key: No chances of recovery within 2 weeks

nextOptions.title:
1-Recovery of end-organ function 
(Cr/UO, ALT/AST, mental status, lactate)

2-TTE suggesting improved cardiac function (LV/RV function; LV size; MR; PA pressures)

LV Venting (Impella; IABP; LV apical cannula) or Indirect LA/PA venting, if:

1. PCWP>20 mmHg
2. Pulse pressure <20
3. Clinical pulmonary edema
4. Evidence of blood stagnation in LV or 
5. aortic root
6. Optimize chance of recovering the ventricle
Stable end-organ function (Cr/UO, ALT/AST, mental status, lactate) and TTE parameters (LV/RV function; LV size; MR; PA pressures)

Stable end-organ function.title: Stable end-organ function
Stable end-organ function.description: Are the patient hemodynamic variables, the end-organ function values looking healthy after we reduce the flow of the device?

If Impella-related complications (e.g. peripheral ischemia, hemolysis)

nextOptions.title: • Consider rapid weaning or alternate MCS strategy
• Careful observation vs Post PCI RHC Escalation Pathway

↓CO, ↓UO, ↑Lactate, ↑Pressors.title: ↓CO, ↓UO, ↑Lactate, ↑Pressors
↓CO, ↓UO, ↑Lactate, ↑Pressors.description:
Escalation if either:
1-High likelihood of recovery
2-Suitable for durable MCS
3-Candidacy for OHT

CPO >0.6; CI>2.2.title: CPO >0.6; CI>2.2
CPO >0.6; CI>2.2.description:
Recovery of end-organ function (Cr/UO, ALT/AST, mental status, lactate)

TTE suggesting improved cardiac function (LV/RV function; LV size; MR; PA pressures)

Low dose vasopressors and ionotropes
explanation: Recovery of end-organ function (Cr/UO, ALT/AST, mental status, lactate).
TTE suggesting improved cardiac function (LV/RV function; LV size; MR; PA pressures).

Stable CO, UO, Lactate, minimal pressor.title: Stable CO, UO, Lactate, minimal pressor requirement
